entry.name: menu
entry.title: Menu Widget
entry.desc: Themeable menu with mouse and keyboard interactions for navigation.

longdesc.p: A menu can be created from any valid markup as long as the elements have a strict parent/child relationship. The most commonly used element is the unordered list (<ul>). Additionally, the contents of each menu item must be wrapped with a block-level DOM element. In the example below <div> elements are used as wrappers:

If you use a structure other than <ul>/<li>, including using the same element for the menu and the menu items, use the menus option to specify a way to differentiate the two elements, e.g., menus: "div.menuElement".
Any menu item can be disabled by adding the ui-state-disabled class to that element.
To add icons to the menu, include them in the markup:
Menu automatically adds the necessary padding to items without icons.
Divider elements can be created by including menu items that contain only spaces and/or dashes:

ul.li: ENTER/SPACE: Invoke the focused menu item's action, which may be opening a submenu.
UP: Move focus to the previous menu item.
DOWN: Move focus to the next menu item.
RIGHT: Open the submenu, if available.
LEFT: Close the current submenu and move focus to the parent menu item. If not in a submenu, do nothing.
ESCAPE: Close the current submenu and move focus to the parent menu item. If not in a submenu, do nothing.

longdesc.p: Typing a letter moves focus to the first item whose title starts with that character. Repeating the same character cycles through matching items. Typing more characters within the one second timer matches those characters.
Disabled items can receive keyboard focus, but do not allow any other interaction.

ul.li:
ui-menu: The outer container of the menu, as well as any nested submenu. This top-level element will additionally have a ui-menu-icons class if the menu contains icons.
ui-menu-item: The container for individual menu items. This contains the element for the item's text itself as well as the element for submenus.
ui-menu-item-wrapper: The wrapper element inside each individual menu item, containting the text content and the icon indicating submenus.
ui-menu-icon: The submenu icons set via the icons option.
ui-menu-divider: Divider elements between menu items.

option.name: icons
option.desc: Icons to use for submenus, matching an icon provided by the jQuery UI CSS Framework.

desc.p: Selector for the elements that serve as the menu items.
desc.div: Note: The items option should not be changed after initialization.

desc.p: Selector for the elements that serve as the menu container, including sub-menus.
desc.div: Note: The menus option should not be changed after initialization. Existing submenus will not be updated.

option.name: position
option.desc: Identifies the position of submenus in relation to the associated parent menu item. The of option defaults to the parent menu item, but you can specify another element to position against. You can refer to the jQuery UI Position utility for more details about the various options.

desc.p: Customize the ARIA roles used for the menu and menu items. The default uses "menuitem" for items. Setting the role option to "listbox" will use "option" for items. If set to null, no roles will be set, which is useful if the menu is being controlled by another element that is maintaining focus.
desc.div: Note: The role option should not be changed after initialization. Existing (sub)menus and menu items will not be updated.

method.name: blur
method.desc: Removes focus from a menu, resets any active element styles and triggers the menu's blur event.

argument.name: event
argument.desc: What triggered the menu to blur.

argument.name: event
argument.desc: What triggered the menu to collapse.

argument.name: event
argument.desc: What triggered the menu to collapse.

argument.name: all
argument.desc: Indicates whether all sub-menus should be closed or only sub-menus below and including the menu that is or contains the target of the triggering event.

method.name: expand
method.desc: Opens the sub-menu below the currently active item, if one exists.

argument.name: event
argument.desc: What triggered the menu to expand.

method.name: focus
method.desc: Activates the given menu item and triggers the menu's focus event. Opens the menu item's sub-menu, if one exists.

argument.name: event
argument.desc: What triggered the menu item to gain focus.

method.name: isFirstItem
method.desc: Returns a boolean value stating whether or not the currently active item is the first item in the menu.

method.name: isLastItem
method.desc: Returns a boolean value stating whether or not the currently active item is the last item in the menu.

method.name: next
method.desc: Moves active state to next menu item.

argument.name: event
argument.desc: What triggered the focus to move.

method.name: nextPage
method.desc: Moves active state to first menu item below the bottom of a scrollable menu or the last item if not scrollable.

argument.name: event
argument.desc: What triggered the focus to move.

method.name: previous
method.desc: Moves active state to previous menu item.

argument.name: event
argument.desc: What triggered the focus to move.

method.name: previousPage
method.desc: Moves active state to first menu item above the top of a scrollable menu or the first item if not scrollable.

argument.name: event
argument.desc: What triggered the focus to move.

method.name: refresh
method.desc: Initializes sub-menus and menu items that have not already been initialized. New menu items, including sub-menus can be added to the menu or all of the contents of the menu can be replaced and then initialized with the refresh() method.

method.name: select
method.desc: Selects the currently active menu item, collapses all sub-menus and triggers the menu's select event.

method.name: _closeOnDocumentClick
method.desc: Method that determines whether clicks on the document should close any open menus. By default, menus are closed unless the click occurred on the menu.

example.desc: Never close menus on document click.

method.name: _isDivider
method.desc: Determines whether an item should actually be represented as a divider instead of a menu item. By default any item that contains just spaces and/or dashes is considered a divider.

example.desc: Treat all items as menu items with no dividers.

event.name: blur
event.desc: Triggered when the menu loses focus.

event.name: focus
event.desc: Triggered when a menu gains focus or when any menu item is activated.

event.name: select
event.desc: Triggered when a menu item is selected.
